TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed FileSystemRights extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines the access rights to use when creating access and audit rules.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The FileSystemRights enumeration specifies which file system actions are allowed for a particular user account and which file system actions are audited for a particular user account.
Use the FileSystemRights enumeration when creating an access rule with the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAccessRule> class or when creating an audit rule with the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemAuditRule> class.
This enumeration contains several granular system rights values and several values that are a combination of those granular values. It is easier to use the combination values such as FullControl, Read, and Write, rather than specifying each component value separately.
## Examples The following code example uses the FileSystemRights enumeration to specify an access rule and then remove the access rule from a file. You must supply a valid user or group account to run this example.
[!code-cs[IO.File.GetAccessControl-SetAccessControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.security.access_7_1.cs)] [!code-vb[IO.File.GetAccessControl-SetAccessControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.security.access_7_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[IO.File.GetAccessControl-SetAccessControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.security.access_7_1.cpp)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights AppendData = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to append data to the end of a file.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights ChangePermissions = int32(262144)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to change the security and audit rules associated with a file or folder.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights CreateDirectories = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to create a folder.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This right requires the Synchronize value. Note that if you do not explicitly set the Synchronize value when creating a file or folder, the Synchronize value will be set automatically for you.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights CreateFiles = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to create a file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This right requires the Synchronize value. Note that if you do not explicitly set the Synchronize value when creating a file or folder, the Synchronize value will be set automatically for you.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights Delete = int32(65536)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to delete a folder or file.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights DeleteSubdirectoriesAndFiles = int32(64)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to delete a folder and any files contained within that folder.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights ExecuteFile = int32(32)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to run an application file.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights FullControl = int32(2032127)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to exert full control over a folder or file, and to modify access control and audit rules. This value represents the right to do anything with a file and is the combination of all rights in this enumeration.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights ListDirectory = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to read the contents of a directory.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights Modify = int32(197055)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to read, write, list folder contents, delete folders and files, and run application files. This right includes the ReadAndExecute right, the Write right, and the Delete right.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights Read = int32(131209)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to open and copy folders or files as read-only. This right includes the ReadData right, ReadExtendedAttributes right, ReadAttributes right, and ReadPermissions right.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights ReadAndExecute = int32(131241)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to open and copy folders or files as read-only, and to run application files. This right includes the Read right and the ExecuteFile right.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights ReadAttributes = int32(128)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to open and copy file system attributes from a folder or file. For example, this value specifies the right to view the file creation or modified date. This does not include the right to read data, extended file system attributes, or access and audit rules.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights ReadData = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to open and copy a file or folder. This does not include the right to read file system attributes, extended file system attributes, or access and audit rules.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights ReadExtendedAttributes = int32(8)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to open and copy extended file system attributes from a folder or file. For example, this value specifies the right to view author and content information. This does not include the right to read data, file system attributes, or access and audit rules.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights ReadPermissions = int32(131072)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to open and copy access and audit rules from a folder or file. This does not include the right to read data, file system attributes, and extended file system attributes.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights Synchronize = int32(1048576)

Docs.summary: Specifies whether the application can wait for a file handle to synchronize with the completion of an I/O operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Synchronize value is automatically set when allowing access, and automatically excluded when denying access.
The right to create a file or folder requires this value. Note that if you do not explicitly set this value when creating a file, the value will be set automatically for you.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights TakeOwnership = int32(524288)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to change the owner of a folder or file. Note that owners of a resource have full access to that resource.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights Traverse = int32(32)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to list the contents of a folder and to run applications contained within that folder.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights Write = int32(278)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to create folders and files, and to add or remove data from files. This right includes the WriteData right, AppendData right, WriteExtendedAttributes right, and WriteAttributes right.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights WriteAttributes = int32(256)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to open and write file system attributes to a folder or file. This does not include the ability to write data, extended attributes, or access and audit rules.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights WriteData = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to open and write to a file or folder. This does not include the right to open and write file system attributes, extended file system attributes, or access and audit rules.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.FileSystemRights WriteExtendedAttributes = int32(16)

Docs.summary: Specifies the right to open and write extended file system attributes to a folder or file. This does not include the ability to write data, attributes, or access and audit rules.
